exceeding_time: Are you sure you want to add report?

toast.24h_error: It is not possible to exercise more than 24 hours per day
toast.exceeding_time: You have entered more time than has passed since the last report. You exceeded the time by

description.technique: E.g. playing and learning songs, warming up, practicing rhythm and various techniques such as alternate picking or legato
description.hearing: E.g. playing or listening to songs or fragments of them by ear, listening and identifying intervals, singing
description.theory: E.g. transcribing and analyzing songs, learning notes on the fretboard, reading sheet music
description.creative: E.g. writing original songs, improvising, working on one's own style
description.exceeding_time: If you forgot to add the time/healthy habit to the previous report or want to report an additional exercise session you did earlier, check this box.
description.sesion_title: Title your session. It will be visible in your calendar.
description.max_days: If you forgot, you can add your report from up to {{days}} days back. However, it won't be counted as consecutive days and will be highlighted on the calendar.

exercise_plan.title: Did you fulfill your exercise plan?
exercise_plan.description: Setting goals and planning your guitar practice is important because it helps maintain motivation, track progress, and achieve desired goals.

new_things.title: Did you practice new things?
new_things.description: Practicing new things on the guitar is important for several reasons. First, it helps develop new skills and improve existing ones. By tackling new challenges, you can try to become a better musician and expand your abilities.

warmup.title: Did you warm up?
warmup.description: A warm up helps prepare your muscles and joints for the physical demands of playing. This can help reduce the risk of injury and make your practice sessions more comfortable. A warm up can also help improve technique and accuracy by getting your fingers and muscles working properly.

metronome.title: Did you use a metronome?
metronome.description: Using a metronome can help improve your sense of timing and rhythm. By practicing with a metronome, you can learn to play in time with a consistent beat and develop a more solid rhythmic foundation.

recording.title: Did you record yourself?
recording.description: Recording yourself allows you to see and hear your playing from a different perspective than when you play live. This can help you notice mistakes or weaknesses that you might have missed.
